summary: This document is a chain of emails from December 2019 discussing the preservation and subsequent reported loss of video surveillance footage from outside the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) cell shared by Jeffrey Epstein and Nicholas Tartaglione during Epstein's alleged first suicide attempt in July 2019. It includes a preservation request from a defense attorney and internal BOP communications about the missing footage.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Inmate who shared a cell with Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York at the time of Epstein's alleged first suicide attempt in July 2019. His inmate number is 78514-054.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate at MCC New York (inmate #76318-054) who was involved in an alleged suicide attempt in his cell shared with Tartaglione on July 22-23, 2019. The subject of the investigation and preservation requests.

persons.name: Aida Ferrer Leisenring
persons.context: Attorney from Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco LLP representing Nicholas Tartaglione. She formally requested preservation of video surveillance footage from the MCC hallway outside Tartaglione's cell for the date/time of the Epstein incident.

connections.description: Shared cell Z06-215 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York at the time of Epstein's alleged suicide attempt in July 2019.
Leisenring is an attorney representing inmate Nicholas Tartaglione, as evidenced by her preservation request for video footage related to his cell.

events.title: Epstein's Alleged First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's alleged first suicide attempt occurred in cell Z06-215 at MCC New York, which he shared with Nicholas Tartaglione, during the early morning hours.

events.title: Preservation Request for Surveillance Video
events.description: Aida Leisenring, attorney for Tartaglione, and a Supervisory Staff Attorney formally requested preservation of video footage from the SHU tier containing cell Z06-215 from 11 pm July 22 to 4 am July 23, 2019.

events.title: Report of Missing Surveillance Video
events.description: An email states the Court was advised by the USAO that MCC did not preserve video from outside the shared cell at the time of Epstein's alleged suicide attempt, contradicting earlier advice from SIS that the footage was preserved.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
Cell Z06-215, SHU tier, MCC New York
U.S. Customs House, 2nd and Chestnut Streets, Philadelphia, PA 19106
Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco LLP, 666 Old Country Road, Ste 700, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: Video surveillance footage from outside cell Z06-215 at MCC New York for the time of Jeffrey Epstein's alleged first suicide attempt (July 22-23, 2019) was reported missing to the Court by December 2019.
The cell (Z06-215) was shared by Jeffrey Epstein and another inmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, at the time of the incident.
A formal preservation request for the video was made on July 25, 2019, by defense attorney Aida Leisenring and a Supervisory Staff Attorney, and SIS initially advised the footage was preserved.
The discrepancy between the USAO's report to the Court (footage not preserved) and SIS's earlier advice (footage preserved) prompted an internal BOP inquiry about what search was performed.
The emails show ongoing monitoring of Epstein's status, with entries for 'Suicide Watch' and 'Psych Observation' on July 9 and July 26, 2019.
